subsection_name: khan-tieng.json_1_Who is at risk for hoarseness (hoarseness)?
subsection_content:
Hoarseness is very common, it is estimated that about 1/3 of the world's population experiences hoarseness at least once in their life.
Hoarseness can occur in both adults and children. However, in people who often have to use their voice continuously or at high volume, such as teachers, singers, coaches, etc., the risk of hoarseness is higher.
In addition, people with flu, sore throat, and cough often have laryngitis, which also causes hoarseness. In addition, hoarseness can also be a functional disorder that is not related to physical damage to the vocal cords.
